intro: Psychotria butibumensis, commonly known as the Butibumé Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. The plant is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses among indigenous communities.
